title: (52004) Melilla - 6 Calle Agustín Herrera
description: Parking in front of the police station. Very close to the city center and the beach. Free. During the fair the first week of September is used as parking for fairground visitors.

title: (52004) Melilla - 4 Paseo Antonio Molina, Guardia Civil
title_short: (52004) Melilla - 4 Paseo Antonio Molina, Guardia Civil
description: Central car park next to the police station

title: (52001) Melilla - Avenida General Macías
description: Parking of the maritime station. Limited to 72 hours. Possibility of spending the night with the agreement of the civil gardia. Citadel 2 steps and all shops in the city center 10 minutes walk. Many cars are parked there, it is better to park at the ends of the car park.

title: (62000) Beni Ansar - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking with caretaker.
I left my motorhome here while I went to see Melilla on foot.
I think you can even sleep, it's dirty and smelly, very peaceful and quiet.

title: (00212) Farkhana - 6209
description: Drinking water tap

title: () Beni Ansar - Unnamed Road
description:
Beach car park
guard the day (paying)
no night guard so free
We spent two nights there with no worries.

title: (52003) Melilla - ML-300
description: Area where you can spend a picnic day,

title: (62024) Beni Ansar -
description: Picnic area and above all a beautiful view of Nador. Space to park 2 or 3 motorhomes on a fairly flat and now relatively clean ground. The place indicated on the application at 7 or 8 km does not exist. On the other hand, a picnic area called macaque area exists about 1 km before the place indicated. It is possible to see a lot of macaques. The place is indescribably dirty and people obviously leave all their rubbish behind.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Numerous picnic areas in the vicinity. We stood at the ruins of the house with a view of the ferry port of Nador. Trees give shade. You can also drive up to the watchtowers and stand there with a better view if it is not too windy. Operation on weekends by day-trippers picnicking.

title: (62000) Beni Ansar - Unnamed Road
description:
Pretty dirty parking, but quiet at night.
3/4 trains pass during the day.
Useful for waiting in the ferry area without going too far.

title: (62852) Bni Sidel Jbel - P6209
description: Superb place to spend the night. Away from the road, under tall pines so with shade and a beautiful view over Nador. No passage, very quiet night. You have to leave the road and take the start of the path then aim for the tall pines on the right.

title: () Gourougou - P6209
description: Only suitable for small campers, because of the narrow pass road, about 9 km uphill, then come a few nice picnic areas, just drive on to some kind of Ecological Centre. There are parking spaces there, if you have a lot of ground clearance you can drive even further to the square. Very nice place on Monte Gourougou. Many locals on Sundays. Great view.

title: (62000) Nador - Unnamed Road
description: Great headland in front of Nador, which separates the Marchica from the Mediterranean. Lots of fish and flamingos. Perfect for a day at the beach or hike etc.

title: () Bou Mahroud -
description: A place above the stone coast directly by the sea, easy to reach from the road via a short slope, even for cars with a little ground clearance. Coordinates for the junction 35.3872778, -3.0081111 In the evening the military comes to check, the soldiers also patrol.

title: () Nador - N15
description: A parking lot at the edge of the road. To help out overnight. Noisy at night (traffic). The police have allowed us to stay as long as we want

title: () Nador - Rocade Mediterraneenne
description: We came here to this truck stop/ fuel station. There were toilets belonging to gas station, also a restaurant ( closed because of Ramadan) and a mini market. There was a night guard who showed us where to park.  It was a bit back from mzin road so not such loud traffic noise. You do head some trucks and voices but it did not worry us. We felt safe.

title: () Bouyafar - Unnamed Road
description: Very spacy parking, with a marvellous 180° view on the sea. No services. Nobody here in wintertime. Soldiers may pass in the evening to make a photo of the "fiche" (passport) and they give you a welcome. Walks along the beach are unfortunately badly clouded by the plastic waste lying around

name: Cafe L3assi Borro
title: () Cafe L3assi Borro
description:
Parking on private land to sleep one or more nights (no maximum). Beach 15 minutes by car, forest within walking distance and various shops and cafes a few meters from the parking lot. The people are very hospitable and friendly and very down to earth. You can explore the region in a different direction where you can walk in the mountains or just take a nice walk in the woods.
The cafe is closed during the day. You can also park next to the café during closing time and from opening time the manager will visit you to provide electricity if necessary and to take care of the payment for the stay.

title: () Province de Driouch - Rocade méditerranéenne
description: Several large parking spaces here. Great view on the sea. Street next door. Good for a stop or more.

title: () Kariat Arekmane - Unnamed Road
description: Car park, overnighting allowed, across from the beach, no services , cpl shops nearby, ok

title: () Ouled Hammou Haddou - N16
description: Drinking water fountain with ball valve. Average flow. Good access from the street. Sheltered behind moat. You can drive the vehicle right next to the fountain.

title: () Ouled Hammou Haddou - Unnamed Road
description: Good drinking water, strong flow. 200 meters from the main road, easy to reach. Large vehicles can also drive next to the fountain. This makes it easy to use even with a short hose. Departure forward in a big curve.

title: () Ouled Youssef -
description: Pitch directly on the sea with a pebble beach on a river estuary, there is a vacant building, probably from the navy and fishermen also use the bay. Unfortunately very littered and no network reception

name: Riad Ocean View
title: (3CG7+HHJ) Riad Ocean View
description: Peaceful, friendly, panoramic view on the Mediterranean Sea.  20 minutes walk to the colorful stone beach, quiet atmosphere, swimming possible, spacious on both sides.  White metal gate in front of the fenced campsite.  Vegetable garden, peacocks, homemade traditional food.  The owner, Abdel, is fluent in Arabic, German and French.  Also good stop before & after the ferry ride in Nador.

title: () Ibayssen - N16
description:
Drinking water point
please do not waste water
possibility of taking a shower at Abdel's.

title: () tmadat sidi elbachir - N16
description: Water point next to the road. Good access. Average flow. You can drive the vehicle right next to the fountain.

title: (62602) Tmadat sidi elbachir - Unnamed Road
description: Panoramic parking on the cliff. Reachable by normal camper, near the gendarmerie. Stairway leading down to a beautiful beach. Forbidden to stay at night

title: () - N19
description: Water source: 2 taps. installation created on 14-07-2019

title: (62902) Hassi Berkane - N19
description: Great place, you will find on site all the amenities. Showers and toilets free. restaurant, grilled meats, local kefta, very good. Shop and small super market. Gas station, finally a real place to advise you for a night stop. The manager of this site is: Mubarak he will receive you with kindness.

title: () Sidi Hsaïn - Rocade méditerranéenne
description: Parking in land of the beach, free outside tourist periods, seaside location or above to the shepherd, ask the agreement to the owner, military supervision and passport control. no water or electricity.

title: (62602) Ayeddim - Unnamed Road
description:
Parking for the Red Beach which, if it weren't full of rubbish, would be very beautiful.
Midweek desert the first of June.

title: (5GX6+MPQ) Tazaghine -
description:
Camping on the beach, secure parking. And restaurant. Public WC.
no service
Unpaved access too difficult and a steep slope. Only in 4×4.
Very calm night.

title: () Ras El Ma - Unnamed Road
description: Stony area at the top of Cap à l'Eau.  The only problem is the cleanliness as often. Fresh bread 5 minutes away by the staircase which leads down to the city.

title: () Ras El Ma - Unnamed Road
description: Parking near the restaurants just before the entrance to the marina and almost opposite a fish market and in front of the restaurant the albatross at Jamil

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: I put the coordinates because no network on this spot and not practical to place with park4night. A great spot in the Karkar Forest (visible on Google Maps) accessible from Nador or Afsou by road and / or driveway (ok with a classic L2H2). Small flat esplanade with superb view of the mountains. There are abandoned buildings nearby, but no one has come, only people with mules who carry wood. Not so dirty for Morocco so let's take care!

title: (4HRJ+7V6) Ras Kebdana - Unnamed Road
description: Parking lot on the beach opposite the border guard, many bathers during the day, especially at the weekend, music noise from the bar next door in the evening. But quiet at night, friendly people, we spent 2 relaxing days here and felt very safe. We could also fill up with water from the bar on request, there was also WiFi.

title: () Ras El Ma - Rocade méditerranéenne
description: Place on the beach with beautiful view on the three Spanish ilands. Good for walking on the beach. Harbor with many restaurants in 10 minutes footwalk along the quai. Store for bred, gas etc. 200m away. No services. Unfortunately a lot of littering like often in Morocco. Nobody here in wintertime.

title: () Ras Kebdana - Rocade Mediterraneenne
description: A parking lot at the entrance to Saidia, access via a gravel road, a little off the road, very quiet in winter with a beautiful view, is above the sea, but has stairs to access the beach.

title: () Hamri - R612
description: Fresh water point with the possibility to fill up with water.

title: (43024) Ouled Yaakoub -
description: Just off the main road. Ideal for one night, the view is beautiful and very little traffic during the day! Place without broken glass but trash cans have remained by mistake certainly …. Not for over 8m

title: () Tafersit -
description: Nice place for a quiet night with a view of the surrounding villages - to the sea - good for an overnight stay in transit

title: () Saidia - Unnamed Road
description: Parking in front of the sea, no service.

title: (63600) Saidia - Bd Hassan II
description: Large flat car park very close to the beach and a restaurant and a Caffè. 25 mins walk to the town center.

title: () - N19
description: Bivouac for camping at the lake of the dam Mohamed V. Access by one track on the right of the N19, 11 km from the highway clockwise Taourirt/Nador. Passing under a bridge of railway height 4 m. Quiet night

title: () -
description: At the edge of the track that sinks further between the hills. Desert landscape and wadi dry, magical. Some cars passed in the evening but night calm

name: Camping L'Amazone saidia
title: () Camping L'Amazone saidia
description: Camping Amazon at 100 m from the beach on Hassan II Avenue.

name: Camping Shams
title: () Camping Shams
description: Camping '' chems '' Camping fee 100 dh including all services, electricity toilets, no hot water. Showers payable 3 dh. For me, it's shit. No pool. Only the beach will exist at 150 meters. a small problem is that the campsite also accepts people who come to visit the beach in the day, that is to say there is a little bit of disturbance. But at night there is calm with light through everything. Another problem is that the campsite is divided into two areas, one where you will find almost 60 tents next to the electricity outlets. the other area is a large area with trees for cars and caravans without electricity. When I asked he told me that in 2018 the campsite is burned and that is why they forbid to place cars and caravans ready tents. For tents, you can either rent a tents ready, more than 60 tents, or install yours next to their tents. For the toilets, yes. their states are good. In any case, I recommend. If you want to rent just a tent already installed its price is 100 dh.

title: () Saïdia - Boulevard Hassan II
description: Parking open 24/24 day and night. No toillettes or services. Surrounded by wall which is good. With guard, you can spend the night at 50 dh. If you want to spend some time you can pay it from 5 dh until 10 dh. 100 m from the beach. Night games for children are nearby

title: () Saïdia - Avenue Mohamed V
description: Parking the rocks. Super parking for the day, only one problem is that it is payable by machine and not by parking attendant. That is per hour. But a guard is in front of the machine, is doing its job as a guard and helps people to take their ticket ... This car park is located on the border between Morocco and Algeria.

title: () Tafoughalt - La Route de Zegzel
description: Parking of the cave of the pigeons, several possibilities to sleep between the 2 caves, barbecue present. Trash can.

title: (63323) Zegzel - زكزل علي ياسين
description: Camel cave parking

title: (60800) Laathamna - Unnamed Road
description: Hard track so off road But not 4X4! The place is clean thank you for making it clean!

title: (32003) Ahdid - N16
description: Direct parking at the gray sand beach, possibility of swimming. No guard.

title: (32000) Centre Ait Youssef Ou Ali - Unnamed Road
title_short: (32000) Centre Ait Youssef Ou Ali - Unnamed Road
description: Very large "Free" parking lot Bamboo fishermen's huts .. We were stopped in 2020, no change.

title: () Ajdir -
description:
Located in a grove. Wonderfully shady. A few steps to the beach.
The beach is mainly visited by locals. We only met nice and helpful people.
Getting there is not very uncomplicated, some ground clearance would be good, 4x4 is not necessary.

title: () Ajdir - N16
description: A drinking water source by the road with good flow.

title: () El Aioun - N6
description: Oilibya service station west entrance of El aioun parking place near the cafe being redone; Nice people little noise at night, we kindly asked if we could stay there for the night, they told us no problem quietly. there are cameras and trucks are there too for the night

title: (20600) Ajdir - Unnamed Road
description: Large playground, very good condition for Morocco, beach, restaurants, pedalos, jet ski.

title: (32000) Al Hoceima - Unnamed Road
description: Large car park facing the beach

title: () Al Hoceïma -
description: Port of AL HOCEIMA parking for the night ... surveillance camera and kindness of the maritime police service ... no service

title: () Al Hoceïma - Unnamed Road
description: Park for day and night, prices for summer are 5 dh the day and 10 dh the night despite the guard goes home at midnight but in any case it's good. no services. Calabonita beach next door. the atmosphere all day. after midnight you will have a quiet night. park surrounded on both sides by wall. nice and kind guardian. the fonts pass from time to time to monitor the beach. which gives a good security for this park. calm night

title: (63XF+2QX) Al Hoceima - Unnamed Road
description: Parking lot at the end of the street. Right above the port. Great view. Quiet at night, lots of local walkers in the evening. 2 minute walk to town with all restaurants. Especially great place for one to two nights

title: () - Route Izemmouren
description: Water point with drinking water

title: (32000) Al Hoceïma - Corniche maritime de Sabadia
title_short: (32000) Al Hoceïma - Corniche maritime de Sabadia
description: Parking day and night. Max 2 nights.

title: () Tala Youssef - Route Izemmouren
description: Free drinking water. Possibility of approaching a few meters to connect a hose.

title: (32000) Al Hoceïma -
description: The parking of Boumedhi beach is prohibited at night, the soldiers say to go here to the parking of Chafarina beach, quiet night.

title: (20000) Taourirt - Bd allal al fassi
description: Good parking opportunity next to the police station.

title: (32024) Idsoulyène - Unnamed Road
description: Parking area above Boumedhi beach. The ground is flat, the road practicable in camper (7m).  The beach below is accessible by a path, the water rises very high, the space is narrow on the pebbles. But it is assured tranquility (in winter)!

title: () Ait Kamara - N16
description: drinking water on the street

title: () Ihamouten -
description: A gravel plain along the road. Easily accessible. Ground may be unstable in rainy weather. The parking lot is surrounded by mountain peaks. Super nice view! We spent a very quiet night there, not much passing traffic.

title: (00000) Izbarian - N16
description: Spot at the edge of a small road a few places for van without any service. The panorama is very pretty with the national park not far away.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Small parking panoramic coffee. Splendid view on the north coast and the mountains of the park of aloceima. The road is paved from the national road near Rouadi. We did not stay at night but it does not seem to be a problem.

title: () Oujda - N6
description: We were able to fill up our German 11kg gas bottle here, but only with butane gas, paid 40 Dh and didn't need an adapter. Also works, were only advised that it can freeze, but in May in Morocco we risk it :). You need a little patience when it's busy.

title: () Ait Cheaib Senada - P5207
description: Roadside water fountain. very good flow.

name: Hotelul Ain Al Hamra
title: (P3P4+PV2) Hotelul Ain Al Hamra
description: Hotel car park. Valid for one night (there is nothing else). The reception is very correct. Moroccan grocery store.

title: () Ait Cheaib Senada - P5207
description: Roadside tap (presumed potable)

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Free parking Marjane Oujda practice to restock. Far from the bivouac champêtre the place is tarred, level and accessible to all templates but without shade. Optimal satellite reception but, 4G perfectible. No services for motorhomes.

title: () Taounil - Unnamed Road
description: Water tap between villages. It's good when the fountain near the school building is occupied. Is on an incline. You can stand 6 meters from the fountain on the roadside. Filling is possible with a hose.

title: () Sidi Moussa Lemhaya - N17
description: Parking of the service station, secure with toilets available. Accessible to all sizes the nuisances of the road are acceptable. No service. Fuel payable by credit card.

title: () Taounil - Unnamed Road
description: Village fountain next to the schoolhouse. Here you can easily drive next to the fountain and stand up straight. Connection also possible with a short hose. On the way to Badis Beach - the shortest land border between two states.

title: (60000) Oujda - Boulevard Zerktouni
description: Parking at the station monitored day and night and in addition police surveillance. Ideal to visit the medina. A bit noisy since the city and exit nightclub around 3am. But top for security.

title: () Sidi Boulenouar - N17
description: Station service, warm welcome

title: () Laatamena Beni Ftah -
description: Next to the old R505. Road is no longer used. Several parking options.

title: () Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera -
title_short: () Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera -
description: Beach accessible by van at cc. Night possible a few meters from the sea. Very warm welcome. Possible to eat or take a boat trip.

address.city: Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera

title: (35100) Guercif - Boulevard de la Résistance
description: Public parking a bit noisy but in the city center, cafes close to the square offers wifi, toilets in the shopping mall 50 m.

title: (5P93+PP2) Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera -
title_short: (5P93+PP2) Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera -
description: Great view

address.city: Peñón de Vélez de la Gomera

title: () Torres-de-Alcala - Unnamed Road
description:
Great picnic air with stunning views. Access via a passable slope.

We spent a day and a night at the place and experienced a fantastic sunset.

title: () Torres-de-Alcala -
description: source of drinking water

title: (32014) Torres-de-Alcala - P5205
description: Parking Torres Beach on a small place by the sea (gratis) Small grocery store 500 m in the village.

title: (32122) Cala Iris - P5205
description: Nice place for a picnic, questionable if it is possible to stay overnight. But a view With a picnic bench and very little rubbish

title: () Guefait - P6048
description: Great place with a nice view

title: () Centre Commune Sidi Ali Belquacem - P6052
title_short: () Centre Commune Sidi Ali Belquacem - P6052
description: Water tap next to the main road. Good access. Average flow.

title: () Cala Iris - P5205
description: Great car park. Absolutely calm. 180° view of the sea. No service. Empty in winter. We went there in summer (July 28, 2018). Very many wild campers, very welcoming.

name: Camping amis de Cala Iris
title: () Camping amis de Cala Iris
description: Camping friends of Cala Iris, calm, sea view, water turquoise color, fishing, diving underwater

title: () Dar Berrouag - P6052
description: Faucet above the main street, good access and exit. Good water flow.

title: (32103) Taghzout Beni Gmil -
description: Place in the middle of the waddi. Do not enter during rain. Free on the beach.

title: () Beni Krama - Unnamed Road
description: No service but secure next to the police station, this place was recommended to us by the police near the center.

name: Camping Benyakoub
title: () Camping Benyakoub
description: Camping Benyakoub, on-site restaurant.

title: (23550) Souk Sebt Boukallal - R505
description: Parking of the restaurant cafe Navarra held by Youssef and his brothers. Possibility to stay several days, use the toilet and fill the water, which comes from the city, which is rather rare in the region. Do not hesitate to taste its grill, the meat of the region is of excellent quality, and the team is very welcoming. Youssef speaks Spanish and a little French.

title: () Debdou - Centre ville
description: Opposite the Gendarmerie de Debdou (drop by to see them to signal themselves) against the college wall, just below the main street. It was the gendarmes who indicated the place to us. Ok for a safe night. Roughly flat terrain. Little traffic at night

title: (65400) Debdou - Unnamed Road
description: Parking at the foot of the kasba. Flat with large stones. View of the plain of Debdou. ideal for visiting the kasba.

title: (35000) Taza - R505
description: Parking lot at gas station Afriquia. There is free toilets and small cafe shop, good for night. It’s near A2 road. There is possible to wash your camper van too.

title: () - Unnamed Road
description: Esplanade next to the school. The access road is bad, but slowly you can get there without a problem. On the way, everyone will offer to buy the local products, a simple one does not smoke and a smile is enough so that they do not insist. We travel with our children and we have not felt insecure. The people are very friendly, it is quite usual to find people who speak Spanish. There is no tourism. They tell us that it is the first motorhome that overnights here. The place is spectacular, full nature. Very cold in winter. It is better to arrive with light so that people see you. Everyone will invite you to go home, so if you do not want to, just smile and say no and thank him.

title: (35000) Taza - S311
description: Suitable for one stage. Parking in the city center near a public garden. Recommended by the Gendarmerie. Guardian .

title: (35000) Taza - Rue Raid Azmag
description: Practical, just in front of the ramparts.

title: () Tazaa -
description: Land next to the cemetery, quiet night except some barking dogs. Otherwise there is a guarded car park near the medina but too noisy. Authentic medina, with a historic mosque that can only be seen from the outside. Here we are not bothered by guides and souvenir merchants.

title: () Ctre Commune El Atef - N19
description: Wasteland at the edge of the road. Very calm

title: (91153) El Jebha - Unnamed Road
description: Nice flat gravel parking next to the local police station. The road is steep concrete and gravel to get up here but worth it for the views and in quiet nature. There is lovely walking here down to the bay and the very long remote beach and back along the top ridge for amazing views.

title: (91153) El Jebeha - N16
description: Free parking right next to the cornice with a view of the sea. We spent 2 very quiet nights there alone in the parking lot with the sound of the waves. grocery store and restaurant nearby

title: () - P19
description: Ain Benimather Spring, parking with toilet and spring water, busy with locals filling spring water in the day quiet at night. although it’s aside the N17

title: (04711) Almerimar - Av. Almerimar
description: On the edge of ALMERIMAR just at the start for hikes in the natural park Mixed lighted and tarmacked parking accessible to any size of motorhome parking possible by respecting the parking spaces Restaurant at the end of the beach parking lot Be careful not to unpack anything the parking lot is authorized day and night on condition that the equipment is not unpacked

title: (04715) El Ejido - 39 Paraje Guardias Viejas
description: Natural beach, without much traffic, ideal for sleeping. To get here, beware of heavy motorhomes as the sand can block them.

title: (91153) El Jebha - N16
description: Huge parking lot in the immediate vicinity of the new Gendarmerie, walking distance to the town center along the new promenade approx. 1 km, beautiful view of the valley

title: (04717) El Ejido - 250 Paraje la Cumbre
description: This tree is in the middle of the route there are many birds and flora of all kinds cool

title: (04715) El Ejido - 10 Paraje el Montecillo
description: In front of the sea

title: (04715) Guardias Viejas - P.º las Olas
description: Nice flat area with other vans parked there. Water available at the shower point on the beach. Superb views of Almerimar across the bay. Nice small corner shop in the village. Castle worth going to 2km away. Bins not far from the shower point.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 36 Calle Mar de Alborán
title_short: (04711) El Ejido - 36 Calle Mar de Alborán
description:
Part of the port but less busy and quieter than the other side. Right next to the beach. Fenced and secure. Access by checking in with the harbor master (speaks English and German) to pay and get the key to access the car park and toilets/showers. Water & electricity included. 4G but TV (with antenna) not good.
ATTENTION: First go to the port office GPS 36.69640, -2.79420

name: Shotwak Hotel
title: () Shotwak Hotel
description: Supervised parking at the Shotwak Hotel, behind a fence. The manager Mohammed requests 20 DH for the night. After a whole day of "harassing" men who want to sell you a joint, it's nice to be in a place where no one can come. You can buy coffee, there is no restaurant but Mohammed can do something. You can use the toilet. The rooms would not be expensive.

title: (04715) Los Baños de Guardias Viejas -
description: A quiet place lulled by the sound of the waves. The police came by twice but didn't tell us anything, we slept very well, garbage cans are available so leave this natural place clean

title: (04715) El Ejido - AL-9036
description: Seaside. Full nature quiet several possible locations on 200 meters, below the castle to visit. Good fishing spot, out of season we stayed one night without problem.

name: Parking de autocaravanas Puerto Deportivo de Almerimar
title: (04711) Parking de autocaravanas Puerto Deportivo de Almerimar
title_short: (04711) Parking de autocaravanas Puerto Deportivo de Almerimar
description: Bon Aire in the harbor with waste disposal and fresh water. Hot showers with toilets available key obtained only at reception with deposit. Short walk required so showers don't close on other side of marina. The views are stunning and there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby as well as a supermarket.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 22 Paseo las Olas
description: Large graveled surface on the beach, plenty of places, fairly easy access, we have a 12-ton plow and 10m long. We settled a little higher up, because the lower places were all occupied by ten motorhomes. The beach is not exceptional but for board sports enthusiasts it is perfect. Garbage cans are available on the beach. The place is pretty clean.

title: (91153) Dchar Amzadji - N16
description: Nice flat gravel parking by the sea. the track to get here is a bit bumpy but worth it for the sea views and quiet location.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 20 Calle del Muro
description: Parking of the old guards of the castle. spectacular views.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 2 Plaza a Piramide
description: Almerimar near the parking lot of the marina.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 14 Calle Sotavento
description: Asphalt parking next to the beach with 6 spaces for large vehicles. Showers and public toilets on the beach. Camping behaviour forbidden by sign.

title: (04711) El Ejido - 2 Plaza de la Bancada
title_short: (04711) El Ejido - 2 Plaza de la Bancada
description: Next to a wind spot. Large car park. Showers on the beach and public toilets. Rental of wind equipment at a reasonable price and lessons. Perfect wind and calm sea. Free parking.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 2 Calle Salazón
description: Asphalt parking with 6 large spaces possible for CCs at least mid November since we are alone. Garbage cans nearby. Lighted, flat and clean. Facing the sea so very windy but the islanders that we are adore! Possible walk for dogs who like to find a little green grass in the region. We slept one night without a problem and the police who came by in the evening didn't tell us anything. Many thanks to the city.

title: () Rass El Ma - R507
description: A beautiful fountain to fill up with water

title: (04711) Almerimar - Unnamed Road
description: Huge free mixed car park accessible to any size of motorhome sea 50 meters away access to the promenade which runs along the beach there is also a cycle path drinking water at the beach parking and sleeping there in winter no problem as long as you do not not unpack table chairs etc

title: (04715) El Ejido - AL-9036
description: Long strip of parking along the beach, good swimming opportunities, beach OK for local standards, surroundings not particularly nice due to the greenhouses. Also suitable for thick ships.

title: () Rass El Ma - R507
description: Nice little corner to picnic in the crook of a bend. To sleep continue climbing up the road to a "recreational area" indicated in a bend by taking the 5km track that is really worth it with water, new wooden picnic tables under tall trees and barbecues.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 10 Calle Aparejo
description: Parking next to the lagoon. Went to park here tonight but there are sign saying no Motorhomes and massive fines if you do however follow road towards sea for 1km further and there is very large carpark overlooking sea with no signs so we stayed here. If it’s noisy etc I will update.

title: () - R507
description: Parking in good condition. It is a beautiful viewpoint of the city of Tazza, with lots of tranquility and a beautiful sunrise. You can spend the night without problems.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 1 Calle Mascarón
description: Large car park without any prohibitions, unlike all car parks by the sea.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 98 Paraje Matagorda
description: Very cheap fuel. Drain gray and black water. Drinking water fill free. Also the possibility to wash and vacuum the camper. (with small change). Friendly staff. Thank you for the good service, compliment!

title: (67F6+QFH) Dchar Amzadji - N16
description: Good place with a wonderful view

name: Camping Mar Azul
title: (04712) Camping Mar Azul
description:
Just 5 km from the "826 - Balerma" exit of the A7 motorway. 
Next to the beach and the town of Balerma. Plots from 70 to 140 m2 with water, drainage, 16 Amp electricity and Wi-Fi. We accept pets except in the bungalows.

Ideal for stopovers: emptying and filling tanks, car wash, tire pressure control, Gas Repsol, Cepsa and CampingGas, Sat TV technician, mechanic 1 km away, washers, dryers and ironing. Mail and parcel service. ACSI Card.
Fresh bread all day in the canteen. Pool, Rent a Car, bus stop.

title: (04715) El Ejido - 57 Calle Rastro
description: Picnic area with barbecue and tables. Very shaded good for a break

title: () -
description: 5 km of very practicable track that are really worth it. To discover absolutely to appreciate the nature and the installations: spring water, tables of picnic in wood under the trees in height and masonry barbecues and garbage cans !! As I post the spot after the event, I do not have a photo and I do not know which branch we followed. But signs will show you the way. And the region is so beautiful!

title: (04711) El Ejido - 10 Diseminado Ctra Almerimar
description: Great car wash, good up to around 4m high. You can also insert coins

title: (04712) El Ejido - 42 Calle Pescadores
description: Turn off drinking water near a supermarket

title: () Tazekka - S311
description: Tazekka National Park Bird Valley Recreation Area. Full of games and public picnic. If you arrive at a late hour or want information about the area, call Jamal: 212 667-410361 park ranger and guide.

title: (34000) Douar Taounate El Kchour - N8
description: Old pit out of order. Quiet night

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar -
description: It's like a nature reserve. Definitely nice to stand and rest during the day BUT I wouldn't sleep there at night. Strange figures came around. One came and warned us that it was not safe to sleep there. According to his statement: Cars are often demolished and robbed there at night. Left the place right away. Road to drive very bumpy and potholes.

title: (04740) Roquetas de Mar - 1 Calle Cóndor
description: Quiet lighted verge, good for one night. Police drove by and said nothing.

title: () - N16
description: Nice place for picnicking, with a superb view, may be possible to spend the night

title: (04779) La Curva - 15 Conjunto la Habana
description: Sandy parking on the beach, has garbage cans and showers, but a bit dirty.

name: Camping Las Vegas
title: (04779) Camping Las Vegas
description: Camping Las Vegas, nice little family campsite. Between greenhouse greenhouse and greenhouse but for a nice night.

title: (04770) Adra - 16-42 Camino del Censo
description: Quiet place, in front of the promenade, and a step away from the beach, there is a beach bar, a children's park and a candy shop, the ldl can be reached by car. The beach is very clean and careful.

title: (18730) Calahonda - 2 Calle Rosales
description:
A water fountain like you see it everywhere in Spain.
It is located between the sports field and the promenade.
According to a local resident, the water comes from the Sierra Nevada.

Parking in the street possible without problems.

title: (18730) Granada - 221 Diseminado el Palmar P41
description: This entire street is used as a parking lot for the adjacent pebble beach. There are outdoor showers on the beach (tall, not just for feet, but just to wash off with water, not soap/shampoo), which was the main reason we went to this beach.

title: (04770) Adra - Avenida del Trafalgar C.F.
description: Quiet parking by the sea to spend the night.

title: (04713) Balanegra - 5 Paseo Marítimo
description: Good Place TO dive. Big Free Park. With Free Wc,bar near and in front of beach.

title: (93100) Taferka -
description: Small quiet area by the roadside but possibility to park out of sight in peace in the middle of the trees. The panorama is great! A few passing cars but nothing bothersome. Some waste unfortunately also.

title: (18730) Carchuna - 1451C Diseminado el Cerrillo P41
description: Castle of Carchuna

title: (18730) Calahonda - Travesía Ricardo León
description: Free parking, lit, in front of the beach with space for about 10-15 camper.

title: (04778) Adra - 16 Calle la Marina
description: Beach near an abandoned school.

title: (18730) Calahonda - 8 Avenida de las Palmeras
description: Normal parking lot parking in line. There are bars nearby and a grocery store. You can spend a maximum of 48 hours as in the whole town.

title: (18730) Motril - Camino Iryda
description: Parking facing the sea. Right next to La Perla cafe. Arrive late at the end of the day or early in the morning to find a place. Beach shower.

name: Camping Don Cactus Grupo Campingred

description: Camping Don Cactus. Environment plastic webs as far as the eye can see. Camping by the sea. Free Wifi. For a step.

Close to the National Security which watches and the guard of the guard station, the parking is in the center of Ain Beni Mathar on the N17. The place is not country but stabilized (on pebbles) and level. Accessible to all sizes, however, it is necessary to go through the station to avoid the relatively high sidewalk. No service, satellite reception and optimal 4G

title: (18730) Calahonda - 1A Calle Nautilus
description: Fountain for filling water canisters. Parking possible. Good water pressure

title: (04713) Berja - 42 Carretera de Málaga
description: Lowcost gas station with bank card and in the supply store sells bottles of butane camping gas

title: (04778) Adra - 37 N-340a
description: Place to spend the night near the beach (quite nice). There is usually no problem with the police for sleeping there. The road can be a bit complicated depending on the time of year, although normally any vehicle can enter.

title: (18730) Calahonda -
description: Viewpoint with spectacular views of the sea. It has no shadow. Ideal for spending the night if you leave early at dawn.

title: (04713) Berja - 28 Poligono Sector R-1
description: It is a very quiet place, we spent the night here. The next day we took advantage of it to be on the beach, since there was no one there. One km from the town of Balanegra, access is somewhat complicated for AC, with a camper you can access without problem, but be careful, there was some garbage, but when we arrived we picked it up to make our stay more pleasant ☺️

title: (18730) Motril - 2 Calle Cueva Alcantara
description: Parking to spend the night in peace without opening windows

title: (18614) Gualchos - Carretera de Almería
description: Quiet place overlooking the sea, has a bit of unevenness. We had an uneventful night. Being a weekday there was not much movement on the road.

title: (18614) Gualchos - 328 N-340
description: Parking by the beach with a beautiful bridge below an incredible cove

title: (18614) Gualchos - Carretera de Almería
description: We always spend one night here has never been a problem. Beautiful view.

title: (18730) - 1341B Diseminado el Cerrillo P41
description: Water pipe between the toilet and the lemon tree. Ask the station manager to let you know. We refilled our clean waters for free after refueling.

title: (18600) Motril - 1D Calle Jayuyo
description: Free ample parking right next to the quite pretty beach if you close your eyes to the plastic polytunnels on one side. There doesn't seem to be any water at the moment but there are garbage cans.

title: (18740) Castell de ferro - N-340
description: Large esplanade overlooking the sea by the road. Stable soil. Relatively flat if you choose your location well, otherwise you have to plan to stall (seriously). Two stone tables and two bins available. The area is clean, superb view. The road is not at all inconvenient. Sound of waves and wind. We had a very good night. Hassle-free access with a large template. Be careful if you arrive at night with a dog: the access to the cliff is not entirely protected and we had a visit from a deer…

title: (18760) La Rábita - Unnamed Road
description: Parking along the beach, you can park with a sea view

title: (18614) Gualchos -
description:
Not the prettiest place, but much more sheltered from the road than the others spots around.
The path is a little rocky but nothing bad.
Tons of space and just the right sight to see the sun rise above the sea

title: (18600) Motril - N-340
description: A privileged site, difficult access, I do not recommend staying overnight, very uneven and lonely, dangerous place to go with children

title: (18730) - N-340
description: Plazoleta de carchuna, stop on your way to buy something in town and continue. you can spend the night.

title: (04770) Adra - Cortijo De La Juana
description: Very cool place... very secluded... good for several nights... making campfires possible... ATTENTION slope only possible for 4x4 or small mobile homes... Access is on dirt track under the giant bridge down... better expire before... right on the beach. Place not everywhere straight.

title: () Adra - ALP-103
description: Repsol gas station with a bar and ample dirt parking, you can stay up late without a problem and I would even say that you can spend the night as well. The girl in the cafeteria is very nice and treats you very well. The cafeteria/bar is large and comfortable.

title: (18760) La Rábita - 2D Calle la Fuente
description: Large parking lot next to the sea, ideal to know the area. There are restaurants that are not expensive and you eat very well.

title: (18614) Castell de Ferro - 2 Carretera Malaga
description: Zone Tropic Autocaravanas - Fully equipped car park with a large supply and disposal area, men's and women's toilets, showers, sink area, washing machine and dryer. 50-200m from the beach. The baker comes every morning (except Sunday). A DIA convenience store is 500m away. French owners.

title: (18760) La Rábita - Nº1, Bajo Calle Carretera
title_short: (18760) La Rábita - Nº1, Bajo Calle Carretera
description: Water source free

name: Camping Huerta Romero en Granada
title: (18740) Camping Huerta Romero en Granada
description: Camping Huerta Romero. Shady place with 10 meters to the beach. We were greeted warmly and since it was the off-season we were allowed to park the trailer in a second place. Restaurants around the corner. Place and the sanitary facilities are well maintained and clean.

title: (18614) Castell de Ferro - GR-5209
description: Laundry neat and clean, clothes dryer, good free Wi-Fi, parking along the road, prices March 2019.

title: (18614) Castell de Ferro - 3 GR-5209
description: BP gas station with LPG and water and air terminal which allowed us to fill our water

name: Área Camper Castell
title: (18740) Área Camper Castell
description: NEW. Parking for caravans and motorhomes located in Castell de Ferro. Newly built and located next to the beach. We have an independent electricity and water outlet, access to bathrooms and showers, a Wi-Fi area and a laundry area. In addition to washer and dryer service, sink and gray water emptying.

title: (04779) Adra - 18 Carretera de Almería
description: Repsol gas station A bit hidden, to the left of the office where you can also access the toilets. Free - thank you very much!

title: (18740) Castell de Ferro - 9 Calle Carlos Cano

Large rest area with washing station (large washer and dryer), water filling, gray emptying and chemical toilet. Restaurant and rest area. Lots of parked trucks.
It's also a petrol station with a grocery shop and a bakery (frech bagets etc.) you can do here all.

Access is on the side of the building a street that goes down to go to the football field. head all the way to the beach, the parking lot is there. police passed by without saying anything . to sleep there was a party suddenly it was quite noisy with the music, but it may not be every day, to see
